results.title: Treatment of hypertension in pregnancy: effect of atenolol on maternal disease, preterm delivery, and fetal growth.
results.text_hl: Treatment of @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertension@@@ in pregnancy: effect of @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ on @DISEASE_Obesity_Maternal @DISEASE_MESH:D000079262 @@@maternal disease@@@, @<m>DISEASE_Premature_Birth</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D047928 @@@preterm delivery@@@, and fetal growth.

citations.NLM: Easterling TR, Carr DB, Brateng D, Diederichs C, Schmucker B. Treatment of hypertension in pregnancy: effect of atenolol on maternal disease, preterm delivery, and fetal growth. Obstet Gynecol. 2001 Sep;98(3):427-33. PMID: 11530124
citations.BibTeX: @article{11530124, title={Treatment of hypertension in pregnancy: effect of atenolol on maternal disease, preterm delivery, and fetal growth.}, author={Easterling TR and Carr DB and Brateng D and Diederichs C and Schmucker B}, journal={Obstet Gynecol}, volume={98}, number={3}, pages={427-33}}

results.title: Atenolol and fetal growth in pregnancies complicated by hypertension.
results.text_hl: In 91 pregnancies (29.2%) no antihypertensive drugs were given. @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@Atenolol@@@ was found to be associated with lower birth weight and ponderal index values, with a trend toward a higher prevalence of @<m>DISEASE_Premature_Birth</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D047928 @@@preterm (<37 weeks) delivery@@@ and small-for-gestational-age babies when compared to other antihypertensive drugs as monotherapy, or to no treatment.

citations.NLM: Lydakis C, Lip GY, Beevers M, Beevers DG. Atenolol and fetal growth in pregnancies complicated by hypertension. Am J Hypertens. 1999 Jun;12(6):541-7. PMID: 10371362
citations.BibTeX: @article{10371362, title={Atenolol and fetal growth in pregnancies complicated by hypertension.}, author={Lydakis C and Lip GY and Beevers M and Beevers DG}, journal={Am J Hypertens}, volume={12}, number={6}, pages={541-7}}
